page.title: 17ECOLOGY OF THE SOUTH CLIFFS
page.content: found at all timesbut in early summer the cliffs are ablaze with colour. Gorse is predominant contrasting with the yellower broom but there is also Thrift,Sea and Red Campion,Ox-Eye Daisy,English Stonecrop and Sheep's Bit higher on the cliffs with an extensive spattering of Bluebells and the triangular stemmed,rare Wild Garlic,locally known as White Bluebells or Stinking Onions for their pungent odour.Purple Bell Heather is widely found and the South cliffs provide the only location for Lady's Fingers.Lower on the cliffs,protected by inaccessibility there is Sea Spleenwort and Sea Purslane.Conifers, Sycamores,Ash and Hawthorn,whose May blossom signifies the end of winter,are found at the top of the cliffs in scrubland.{ANIMALS}The cliffs are the natural habitat of a
